alert.note: Alert for Coke; Runnels; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coke, north central Tom Green and west central Runnels Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, or 8 miles west of Orient, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maverick, Bronte, Fort Chadbourne, Orient, Norton, Tennyson and The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
